rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: Welcoming space with ample natural light from floor-to-ceiling windows; located near the entrance for easy access.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: Open-plan area featuring large floor-to-ceiling windows on the west façade to enhance natural light and ventilation, in accordance with Vastu principles for energy flow.

rooms.name: Dining Area
rooms.description: Connected to the living room with sliding glass doors; benefits from cross-ventilation through open windows and alignment with natural light considerations.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: Functional kitchen space designed for efficient workflow, featuring floor-to-ceiling windows to provide natural light. Positioned in the eastern section of the ground floor as per Vastu recommendations.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: Spacious master bedroom with a private balcony; designed with east or north facing windows for balanced natural light and ventilation, following Vastu guidelines for health and prosperity.

rooms.name: Guest Bedroom
rooms.description: Comfortable guest bedroom with built-in storage and floor-to-ceiling windows ensuring ample daylight, located in a quieter section of the ground floor.

openings.description: Large sliding door allowing for an open transition between spaces; designed with natural materials and glass accents.
Floor-to-ceiling windows providing abundant natural light, ensuring optimal ventilation while respecting privacy.
Multiple fixed windows facilitating cross-ventilation and brightening the space.
Seamless transition with glass panels for enhanced natural light distribution.

vastu_considerations.detail: Floor-to-ceiling windows on the west façade to ensure ample daylight while balancing heat gain. Cross ventilation designed through strategically placed openings.
Living room and kitchen are oriented towards the east/north for positive energy flow, in accordance with Vastu principles.

building_norms.detail: The design is optimized for a 60x90 feet plot ensuring compliance with local building norms and zoning requirements.
Adopting Colonial architectural elements such as pitched roofs, exposed brickwork or stone facades, and large windows to reflect the style.
